A React app that fetches Github repositories

The UI below was built during an interview I did recently for Sonar, the company behind SonarQube. The challenge was to build a React app that consists of an input field that when changed will query the GitHub Repos API with whatever search string the input contains.

The code for this project can be found on my GitHub here. The way it works is by typing a search string in the input below. That will trigger a fetch from the GitHub Repos API; the results of which will be rendered below the input field. These results are paginated, and you can fetch the next five results by clicking the green “Load more” button.

Note: The API is rate limited. I’ve implemented some debouncing on the input field to mitigate this.
